page.title: 06Grantham:New Somerby
page.content: The south-eastern suburb of New Somerby was originally built after the area had been opened to housing after the construction of the Grantham Cemetary in the middle of the last century.There is a chapel and a crematorium in the cemetary confines.Also there one can find amongst the graves the memorial to nearly 80 Grantham people killed in air-raids during the Second World War.The southern part of the suburb is largely a post-war development on either side of Somerby Hill.On the River Witham there is the very well restored Spittlegate Mill now used as Head Office premises by Vacu-Lug Traction Tyres Ltd., whose factory for the reconditioning of tyres remolding is in the north of Grantham.
